item.title: Tensions between Trump and Europe could have an unintended beneficiary: China
item.description: As the Trump administration shakes up transatlantic ties, analysts told CNBC that China is making strategic moves to get closer to Europe.

item.title: Trump appeals order reinstating fired NLRB member, judge tells him 'president is not a king'
item.description: Gwynne Wilcox was the first National Labor Relations Board member ever fired. A judge said Trump does not have the power to fire board members 'at wil...

item.title: Trump blames ‘globalists’ for stock market sell-off
item.description: President Donald Trump also reiterated that his tariffs could, at least briefly, cause "disruption" in the equity markets.

item.title: House censures Rep. Al Green for heckling Trump during speech to Congress
item.description: Fewer than 30 members of the House of Representatives have been censured. "Truthfully, I would do it again," Green said about interrupting President T...

item.title: Appeals court allows Trump administration to remove ethics watchdog Dellinger — for now
item.description: The Supreme Court is likely to determine whether President Donald Trump can fire Hampton Dellinger as head of the Office of Special Counsel.
